alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 8:13PM EDT until March 27 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County. .A strong storm system has produced moderate to heavy rainfall. This rainfall has resulted in rises on rivers and streams. More rain is forecast over the next next 24 hours.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.to rise rapidly Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-251215- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0002.000000T0000Z-230327T2100Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.230325T0445Z.230326T0600Z.230327T1500Z.NO/ 813 PM EDT Fri Mar 24 2023 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. At 13.3 feet, Flood waters reach Newport Avenue in Uhrichsville as well as East 12th Street and North Main Street half way to East 11th Street. Phac Park along Little Stillwater Creek in Dennison is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 11.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.1 feet on 11/13/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
